title: Suit Warehouse
description: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to get an account, Darryl goes for an interview with Jim's new business, and everybody in the office goes crazy over a new espresso machine.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight's computer chimes]

quotes.speaker: New Instant Message
quotes.text: Stone & Son Suit Warehouse contract expired with their paper provider! Go get it! -David Wallace

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stone and Son Suit Warehouse recently lost their paper provider. They're a family owned business [chuckles]. Jim and I used to clean up at those. We'd go in pretending to be family - brothers. We did it at a family owned law firm, at a family owned construction company, and a family owned motorcycle store.  Jim and Dwight Shrupert. I was the dynamic, likeable winner that was doted upon by Mom. And Jim was the closeted foot fetishist pretending to belong. The client never knew any of that, but I knew.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone with Jim] I hope you've been paying your wig storage bills Jimbo, because it's time for another episode of "Handsome and Stinky, paper brothers for hire".

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry, Stinky, can't do it. Too busy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, god, this again? You're Stinky.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. There's no possible way I can get there, so just ask Phyllis. She can be your older sister or something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phyllis, my sister? More like my dead great great grandmother who died of stupidity.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have ears, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, do you really have ears, Phyllis? Like all human beings? We all have ears. [back to Jim] See what you leave me with here, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, I'm in Philadelphia right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How is that my problem? Get in your car and drive down here. You can make it in 30 minutes if you drive 240 miles per hour.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh. How long would it take me if I drove 300 miles an hour?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm. That's a good... question. 300 times... [Jim hangs up] 180... Um that comes to 25 minutes. [realizes Jim hung up] Yes. Oh, well, thank you Jim. Yes, I am better than you. Thanks for acknowledging that. Okay, bye bye. Love you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Darryl, looking good!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Heading to Philly. Interview with Jim's company.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, good luck. When you get to Philly, will you tell Jim I miss him?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why don't you come along and tell him yourself?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ha ha. That'd be great. Kind of like ditching school, except instead of getting suspended, you get... What do you get? Oh my god! Why didn't I think of this? Andy's not here. Oh, hey, Erin, um, I'm expecting a shipment of pens. Can you cover that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Mhm. Cover that. What does that mean, exactly? What are we talking here? Details.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A delivery guy will deliver a box of pens, and you just make sure everything's in order.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What? Everything? What, how do I make sure it's in order? I [laughs] haven't been trained for this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles] Okay, see you later.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Clark!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, look who's back, Dwight Junior.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, so how was it? I mean... the sex with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: A gentleman doesn't discuss such matters. Especially when the feelings of a lady are involved.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Women reach their sexual peak at whatever age Jan was last week. I mean it was... like making love with a wild animal. But not like a cougar like you might think. It was uh... like a swarm of bees. Bees that just find something wrong with every hotel room.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nothing wrong with being a gentleman. Like my mom used to say, "Talk classy, act nasty".

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: What's with the wig Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What, is it on backwards? [partially removes wig, revealing her bald head]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Nope, you got it. You fixed it. Uh, I have a gift from Jan. It's an espresso maker! We came to be quite fond of espresso on the Amalfi Coast so... bon appetite.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ooo! 16 types of espresso! Now that's Italian.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My friend has one of these. Fool-proof espresso every time.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Always with the friends Oscar. Can't we just enjoy the new espresso machine?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, it's pronounced "espresso"... Wait. That's what you said. I apologize, I just assumed you would mispronounce it. So...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There he is! [chuckles] We are all so proud of you for the small part that you played in landing the white pages. Prouder of me, but...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: If you really want to show appreciation, just give me half the commission.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gosh, you know, I wish I could but, uh... No. Hey, listen, remember how everyone used to call you Dwight Junior and how much you loved that?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [sarcastically chuckling] I loved it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How would you like to pretend to by my son in order to land a sale?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: If it'll lead to me being a salesman, I'll pretend to be your friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then looks like we have a deal... Son [holds up a suit identical to his]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi guys!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, look who it is!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry. Super-busy. Pens coming in later, just grabbing a Java before all hell breaks loose.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Try this one. [handing Erin a cup of espresso]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you! [leaves the room]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't really have time to think about Pete right now. I just have a lot going on with this whole shipment of pens. And I have a lot of people trusting me, and I would feel super guilty if I broke anyone's trust. About the pens.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You ready for your interview?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I was born ready! No, I suck at interviews. I had Andy's job in the bag until my interview.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you shouldn't be nervous about this. This is a tiny start-up with a bunch of guys just as dorky as Jim.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, you can't be scared of a room full of Jims. I love the guy, but he's basically Gumby with hair. [Darryl laughs]

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: [chuckling] It's kind of funny, a father and son sales team meeting with a father and son suit store.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, you're right! We hadn't even thought of that, had we boy? [to Clark]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: No, we sure hadn't Pop. [both chuckling]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Takes picture from desk] Oh! You're a hunter I see. Spend your early mornings out in the blinds, like Clarky and me. Huh? [grabs Clark's shoulder]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: He calls me Clarky 'cause he's my Dad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guilty!

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: You don't meet many hunters these days.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: My dad is the best hunter there is. I mean, he's like a serial killer... of animals. One time, he snuck up behind a sleeping deer and just sawed its head right of. It was sick! [Dwight imitates sawing and blood spurting out of his neck, then makes a dying noise]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was his birthday, just turned three. So...

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Ahh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You guys, I kind of think I want to try them all. Is that crazy?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No. Look, without a taste test, how are we supposed to know which flavors we like to reorder?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Taste test? I'm in!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: YOLO! [singing and dancing]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What? [everyone is confused]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's a thing. It means "you only live once".

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, we're aware of what it means Oscar, you just do not look cool saying it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Alright everybody, who's in? [everyone except Angela puts their hand in the middle of the group, like a huddle] Angela? [Angela shakes her head] Don't make us come over there.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I don't... no.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Alright, let's go. [starts shuffling the whole group towards Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can't I just agree without putting my hand in?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Absolutely not!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, fine. [puts a napkin on top of everyone else's hands and reluctantly puts her own hand on the napkin]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ok guys, "we all drink them all".

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: [Meredith, Phyllis, Nellie, Angela, Creed, Oscar, Stanley] We all drink them all!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, where's my ring?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm sure it'll turn up.

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: [in the background] Yes ma'am, you want to go east on Franklin, take that all the way to Commonweath. You'll see us on the right side, you can't miss us.

quotes.speaker: Dennis
quotes.text: ...And I want to reach every demographic possible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I hear what you're saying, and we will. The thing is, we gotta lock down this key demographic first. The rest will come, I promise. Just give me a couple weeks, alright?

quotes.speaker: Dennis
quotes.text: We're talking weeks here, not months, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Weeks. Always weeks. Man, the last time I talked months was like, a million weeks ago.

quotes.speaker: Dennis
quotes.text: Alright. Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks Dennis, I appreciate it. [To Pam] Hey! How are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just wanted to see you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's so great!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Damn! Jim, you got a real Facebook energy going on here man. You Zuckerberged this place out!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's pretty great, right? I mean, we're coming along... [to coworker] Hey, Wade, we gotta just push up Dennis's timeline

quotes.speaker: Wade
quotes.text: Okay

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [back to Pam] Actually, you know what? Give me one second, okay? Make yourselves at home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...But I think that all of your concerns will be answered when you see the brochure that Clark's getting out of my car. He's a good boy, does whatever I say.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: [sighs] I can't relate to that, my son hates my guts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh... really.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Bring him into the business, and he resents me. How do you like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [fumbling] Well, things between me and Clark are good, but not great. In fact, I will say that they're not even good. Really, they're bad. Like you and your son.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [enters] Here you go, Pop! I know it was just a couple minutes, but... God I missed you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What took you so long? Were you loitering out there like a hooligan, smoking a doobie?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [confused] I sure was. Just like he taught me, looking cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're being disrespectful!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: ...And I love you, for saying that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispers to Clark] We don't get along.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [catches on] Ha ha! I just burned him. Because the truth is... our relationship is... terr-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Terrible!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Terrible.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! Genius. Stupid, stupid genius!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, this place is... so great. I had no idea - on the phone, you made it sound kind of dinky.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I mean, I don't even have the paycheck yet. It is a startup, so... These things go down all the time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If this company's going down, I wanna go down on it. With it. I wanna go down with it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] Are you cool to just hang out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure, no problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah? [to Darryl] You ready?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The pen delivery went amazing, and now I've got all these pens just waiting to be unpacked. But Pam did not tell me to unpack the pens, and I'm not one of those people who's just like, "Uh, sure. I'll accept the pens when they come in, and then as soon as your back's turned, I unpack the pens and get all this credit as some great pen unpacker. On the other hand... they are just sitting here. Pam didn't tell me not to unpack them. Don't want to be a busybody, but I don't want to be a lazybones. Busybody, lazybones. Busybody, lazybones. Ahh! My brain is ping-ponging around in my head right now, it's insane! I'm sorry, what was your question again? Oh yeah, no. I've never had an espresso before. They're good though.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: A-bam! [slams espresso cup on table] My favorite is Viennese Amaretto. And the worst flavor I've tried so far is Alpine Select!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes! [giggles and picks up Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ugh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: One! [as he picks Angela up in the air]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin! Kevin! Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Two... [picks Angela up again]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Three...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's enough Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop it Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Four!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's enough!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So for your menswear catalogue, I think we can offer you some very competitive pricing.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: I heard that before...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, I understand, but -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I bet you have. He knows nothing about what people have heard before, my son.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Here we go again, another lecture from the old man.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Listen to him. He created you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe if you listened a little bit, you'd improve. No wonder women despise you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Women don't despise me...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: His last girlfriend was a transvestite. I knew it right away. Adam's apple like the prow of a ship, thumbs like a lowland gorilla. Ha, but this one couldn't see it, or didn't wanna see it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Alright, that's enough, 'cause I can say some things about him too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah? Like what?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Like the time that you got drunk and, and then... Killed those kids on their way to prom!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That never happened. He's always been a liar. Ever since he was a little kid. He got caught "saving treats" from the kitty litter box.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Really shameful...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So we can offer you matte or glossy printing-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Glistening brown morsels tumbling from every pouch in his trousers.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: There's obviously a volume discount uh, if you-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Following the cat around on his knees with his hands cupped beneath its tail, going "please kitty, may I have some more?" You can't make this stuff up!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: No, I think someone could make it up. Someone with very few friends.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: Hey fellas, sorry to keep you waiting.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Here he is, my son.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Got cat turd collector written all over him.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: ...Did you say cat turd collector?

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: ...So definitely looking to expand our market, but for now we're just concentrating on athletes that are popular here in the northeast. Of course, that's not a mandate.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: "Mandate"- Always think of two men on a date. [awkward moment] I have gay friends... I have one gay friend. [to Jim] Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hm

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: Alright, so what makes you think you'd be a good fit here?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [freezes] Ummm... [a moment later] Alright. Obviously y'all look really busy, and uh, I don't want to waste your time anymore. Sorry, I just uhh... Obviously I'm not qualified to be here man, I'm...  I'm a warehouse manager, you know...

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: Darryl, I was a newspaper editor.

quotes.speaker: Female Athlead Employee
quotes.text: Science teacher, volleyball coach.

quotes.speaker: 3rd Athlead Employee
quotes.text: I work at a home shopping network.

quotes.speaker: 4th Athlead Employee
quotes.text: I'm a laywer. I'm the only one here who can honestly help. [group chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And as you know, I was a paper salesman. [whispers to Darryl] Hey, I find it helps if you just picture everybody naked. [group overhears and chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cool. Hey, thanks...

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: So how about we start over, hmm? Darryl, do you have any thoughts on the company?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, as a matter of fact, I uh... [pulls booklets from his bag] I wrote some down. There you go. [passes out booklets] Wow, this guy came prepared, it impresses me! [group laughs]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ah! So, this is what 2:00 P.M. looks like around here!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I usually take a siesta about now.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [to Erin] Stocking pens, huh? You're like the new office administrator.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, I just took over the pen shipment because Pam had to leave. When I say it out loud, I know that sounds insane, but it's the truth, I swear.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam! Pam, look out! Erin's gunning for your job!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, I'm not! [Kevin imitates gunfire] It's not like that at all! Forget it, I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam, look out!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pens, you did not buy into this. I am sorry, what a day you've had.

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: By the way, Jim talks about you all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's sweet that he talks about me.

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: It's too bad he still hast to work part time in Scranton though...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, that's funny because I think of him as working part time in Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: We can't wait until you move here.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: I'm sorry, you guys are here to sell us paper?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you mind? The men are talking.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: Sons used to idolize their fathers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Us old timers need to stick together. And how better than by signing a contract?

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Father
quotes.text: I'd love to! Sam Junior here, he runs the business now. Kind of pushed me out, truth be told. I'm just here for human contract.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: Okay Pop...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, so you're the boss?

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hi, I'm Clark.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Let's talk.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So if you look at our catalog here...

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: Well, thanks for coming down Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Female Athlead Employee
quotes.text: It was nice meeting you Darryl, I think you'd fit in great here.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah me too. I think it'd be like... You know what? [grabs basketball] I think it'd be like a Kevin Durant jump shot... Perfecto! [shoots basketball at hoop on wall, basketball misses and lands in fish tank, killing the fish] Oh my god...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're the ones who put a fish tank next to a basketball hoop. It's like if I put a glass of milk on the edge of the table and Cece knocks it over, I don't blame Cece.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So I'm like a three year old girl in this scenario...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Say they don't hire you. It's not like you're out on the street. You have a great job with people who love you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And I'd only get to see Jada on the weekends. You know, I'm... I'm not so sure I'd like living in Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right? Thank you! It's just Philly. Everyone's acting like it's New York or Paris or London.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who needs it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [enters] Okay, so the consensus was that that was unique. They're going to make you pay for the fish, and... they wanted to know when you can start.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What? [Jim shrugs] How about yesterday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess you gotta move to Philly after all.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, I love Philly! Two-One-Five or die!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I'm not upset. I'm really excited for Darryl... Maybe I'm a little disappointed that we'll be losing him.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It feels really hot in here. Is it hot in here? It feels really really hot in here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's insane! They need to have the A.C. on year round! January too!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [banging on window] I don't get the point of this stupid window!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I mean, look, you and I both know that in paper or fashion, styles change. Check out my dad's suit. You are looking at pure acrylic. That's why his face always breaks out.

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: Does that suit come with a fire extinguisher? [Clark chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You know what Dad? Maybe you should buy me a suit. I mean, I'm going to need one right? If I'm ever going to get a "real job" and move my "lazy ass" out of your "G.D. house".

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: He's got you there...

quotes.speaker: Suit Store Son
quotes.text: [to Clark in dressing room] That's Italian silk. Very comfortable. Very tasteful... Although expensive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, you don't want Italian. You'll look like a mafia don. Next thing you know, you'll be doing life in Rikers Island.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, that's better than looking like the undertaker from boring island.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That place doesn't exist. It's not a documented island. Ha ha, cartograph much?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [emerges from dressing room wearing a sharp black suit] How do I look?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually... You look great. They steered you right. I guess it does make sense buying from a father son team. You know what? I'll take one too.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Everyone! Now that we have all this energy, why don't we move the copier into the annex like we've always wanted to?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Frickin' A!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So long, noise!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: One, two, three! [all gather around copier and push, tearing carpet beneath]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: And we have torn up the carpet! Oh, we're going to be in so much trouble!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wait! [looking at the hardwood floor beneath the carpet] It's beautiful. Hardwood! I always knew it was down here, I just never dreamed that I would actually see it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Tear up the carpet!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Kill their fish, and they still hire me. That's how you do that, baby. It's all good, I'm ready. Y'all ready for this? [sings intro to "Everybody dance now", points to Pam to sing first line]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [reluctantly] Everybody dance now... [Darryl continues singing]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin, move. I can't pull up the rug if you're standing on it with your rhinoceros feet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well I can't stand here if you pull the carpet out from under me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, my head is killing me. Does anyone have a baby asprin?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, enough with the whining already! Why don't you just have some more coffee?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's all gone. I didn't get a chance to try them all because Creed poured my Bogota Sunrise in the plant.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I saw the leaves twitch!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You shut up!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Everybody shut up and work!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We don't work for you!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hey, it's five o'clock. [everyone leaves and a traffic backup occurs in the parking lot]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [with horns honking] Kevin, can-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! We did it! [leaving the suit store]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You opened the door-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you closed it. The boys are back in town. [high fives Clark] High fives! Ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey, so all that really specific cat turd business, that was about you, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You got me! [tickles Clark and chuckles] I used to collect them!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Each one is very different, like a snowflake.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [shocked after seeing the torn up carpet] Hey... What happened here?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You left me in charge of the pens, Pam. That's what happened. The pens happened.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...Are the pens here?
